title: Buttigieg accuses Sanders, Warren of not trusting American people
text:
Amid a heated debate about health care — pitting those in support of Medicare-for-all against those in favor of alternate options — South Bend, Ind., Mayor Pete Buttigieg accused Sen. Bernie Sanders and Sen. Elizabeth Warren of not trusting the American people.

“The problem, Sen. Sanders, with the ‘damn bill’ that he wrote, and that Sen. Warren backs, is that it doesn’t trust the American people,” Buttigieg said. “I trust you to choose what makes the most sense for you. Not my way or the highway.”

Trying to distinguish his own plan, which he has dubbed “Medicare-for-all who want it,” Buttigieg suggested giving the public “a version of Medicare” and letting them “figure that out for themselves.”

“I trust the American people to make the right choice for them,” Buttigieg said, before turning to Sanders and Warren. “Why don’t you?”

Sanders responded by saying Medicare-for-all would cover all basic needs, including home health care, and would allow patients to go to any doctor they wanted, unlike some private insurance programs.

“So if you want comprehensive health care, freedom of choice regarding doctor or hospital, no more than $200 a year for prescription drugs … moving to Medicare-for-all is the way to go,” Sanders said.
